alert.note: Alert for Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:53AM CDT until March 31 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT FOR EASTERN CRENSHAW AND COVINGTON COUNTIES... At 153 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Grady to 4 miles northwest of Laurel Hill, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Andalusia, Opp, Luverne, Florala, Brantley, Lockhart, Rutledge, Dozier, Heath, Glenwood and Petrey. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central Alabama...and northwestern Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
